content.rendered:
Make the most of your Corporate Membership! Employees of Corporate Member companies enjoy special benefits all weekend long!

Weekend perks include:

  • Complimentary admission for you and up to three guests
  • 25% discount on documentary and feature IMAX® tickets
  • Buy one, get one free evening laser tickets

Show proof of employment (company badge, business card, etc.) to access benefits. Discounts can only be redeemed in person. 

Your Corporate Membership provides essential support that makes possible all PacSci has to offer, including the exhibits and programs that increase access to STEM learning each year for over 600,000 children, families, and adults in Washington state and beyond.

Check if your company is part of our membership program on our Corporate Membership web page or email our Corporate Membership Team.

excerpt.rendered: Make the most of your Corporate Membership at Pacific Science Center during Corporate Member Weekend.

title.rendered: Dork Side of the Moon: A Science Comedy Show

content.rendered:
Join us for a smart, silly, and delightfully nerdy comedy night featuring three standout performers.

Headliner Sarah Hagen, a mathematician-turned-comedian, takes the audience on a hilarious, slightly risqué, and surprisingly accurate journey through how the Ancient Greeks measured the distance to the moon and sun—back when “memes” were carved into pottery.

She’s joined by producer Naomi Fitter, a Midwest escapee whose soft-spoken wit has landed her on stages with top comedians and on NPR’s Live Wire. Naomi is known for running hit nerd-themed comedy shows across the West Coast and for creating Jon the Robot, a stand-up comic featured in TIME Magazine.

Opening the night is Jenna Nobs, a librarian-turned-comedian whose clever, language-loving humor explores everything from education to Smash Mouth. Jenna has performed at Bumbershoot and the Wet City Comedy Festival.

Three comedians. One brilliantly nerdy night of laughs. Don’t miss it.

Tickets

  • General: $25
  • Members: $20

About the Performers

Sarah Hagen, headliner of the show, is a mostly normal person with an irritating obsession with mathematics. In an act of wild desperation, she began moonlighting as a stand-up comedian with the express purpose of incorporating mathematics into comedy. Seven years later, she is a fixture of the northwest comedy scene and co-producer of the touring STEM vaudeville show Singu-hilarity, as well as the popular recurring show Naughty but Nerdy, which runs all over the West Coast. She holds a PhD in mathematics and is a former OMSI Science Communication Fellow.

Naomi Fitter, producer of the show, escaped from Ohio at the age of 22. Her soothing midwestern voice has been described as “sexy,” “librarian-like,” and “nearly inaudible.” She has opened for Aparna Nancherla, Laurie Kilmartin, and Whitney Cummings and performed in the All Jane Comedy Festival. Naomi runs nerdy comedy shows like Naughty but Nerdy and STEM Cabaret all over the West Coast, and she has been featured on the NPR-distributed show Live Wire with Luke Burbank and the Dork Forest with Jackie Kashian. Her robotic stand-up comedian, Jon the Robot, was featured in TIME Magazine.

Jenna Nobs, our opening act, is a librarian turned stand-up whose act embodies a playful love of language. Wry but inviting, she explores everything from education and relationships to Smash Mouth. Jenna has opened for Ali Kolbert and performed at Bumbershoot and Wet City Comedy Festival.

title.rendered: Live at the Laser Dome: KEXP DJ in Residence

content.rendered:
PacSci and KEXP’s Live at the Laser Dome: KEXP DJ in Residence is excited to welcome Sonic Reducer’s DJs for January, February, and March in the Laser Dome!

Every three months on the first Wednesday of the month, a different KEXP DJ will curate a series of monthly playlists for the Laser Dome. The select DJ will then perform a live set accompanying the laser performance once a month at the Laser Dome.

About Sonic Reducer

Sonic Reducer brings you three hours of the best in local, national, international punk and hardcore. Your hosts, Brian, Jenn and Dr. West, drag you through a mess of short, fast and loud songs from today and back in the day

DJ

Dr. West

DJ Mr. West has been a radio DJ since 1998. He co-created a punk show in Minneapolis on Radio K called Out of Step and later co-created KEXP’s Sonic Reducer punk specialty show with Brian Foss and Nick Turner. He enjoys almost everything on the following record labels: Iron Lung; Sub Pop; Dirtnap; Dirtcult; 12XU.

excerpt.rendered: PacSci and KEXP’s Live at the Laser Dome: KEXP DJ in Residence is excited to welcome Sonic Reducer’s DJ Dr. West in March.

content.rendered:
Make it a date night with the blend of pop and R&B from Olivia Dean at 7:30 p.m., then stick around for indie pop sensation Lana Del Rey at 9 p.m. Enjoy a full-dome laser spectacle synced to your favorite pop hits. Perfect for a Galentine’s night or date with epic music and dazzling visuals!

  • Laser Olivia Dean: 7:30 p.m.
  • Laser Lana Del Rey: 9 p.m.

Know Before You Go

  • Laser nights are recommended for teens and adults.
  • Seating is first come, first served. Bring a pillow and blanket if you want to lay on the floor!
  • Food and drink from concessions are welcome inside the Laser Dome.
  • Shows can sell out, advance tickets strongly recommended.

content.rendered:
Celebrate Valentine’s Day at PacSci, whether you’re single, coupled up, or somewhere in between! Experience a Live Comedy Dating Show; explore the Tropical Butterfly House; get a tarot reading; and mingle with new faces at the Anti-Freeze Mixer!

What to Expect

  • Full access to 70+ exhibits
  • Hundreds of science lovers ready to mix, mingle, and make memories
  • Mating and Dating: Learn about love, sex, mating and relationships in the animal kingdom with Woodland Park Zoo’s Janel Kempf
  • Web of Desire: Learn all about spiders and watch them being fed with Hannah Held, PacSci’s Living Exhibit Manager
  • Paint and Sip: Grab a canvas, paint a friend, and create a masterpiece to take home.
  • Free Tarot readings with Primal Mystic Tarot and Susanna Cagle of Attune Yoga
  • Free Caricature Art by Catch the Sunshine: “What do you look like as a flower?”
  • Discounts on evening laser shows

MOre information

Fun & Flirty Comedy Show: PNW’s favorite interactive hybrid comedy/dating show that brings together love laughter, and this time – science! Hosted by comedians Zahnae Aquino and Jesse Warren, Fun & Flirty explores the essence of dating in Seattle by presenting local singles with the help of the city’s best comedians and a PowerPoint presentation highlighting all the very best attributes of the featured single hoping to find romance. There is a cast of hot, sexy singles that are pitched to the audience by comedians and also live speed dates consisting of audience members.

The Anti Freeze Mixer: Hosted by the Seattle Social Club
Looking to meet friends or more? Swing by the Anti Freeze Mixer which will have a variety of activities led by the Seattle Social Club.

View the Drink & Food Menu

Tickets

Bringing friends? Buy 2, get the third 50% off! Enter promo code “AfterDark” in the upper right-hand corner before adding tickets to the cart to receive your discount. Discount automatically applies at check out.

Drinks are not included in ticket price.

  • $22 Igniters
  • $40 Members
  • $45 Non-members

excerpt.rendered: Step into PacSci after hours for an unforgettable evening filled with laughter, connections, and a dash of science magic!

content.rendered:
PacSci’s annual Ignite Luncheon brings together our community’s business, philanthropic, and civic leaders to celebrate the power of curiosity and innovation.

Details

Friday, May 15, 2026, from 10:45 a.m.–1 p.m.

Fisher Pavilion, located within the Seattle Center

Schedule

  • 10:45 a.m.: Registration, networking, and live science demonstrations
  • 11:30 a.m.:
    • Lunch and Program
    • Invest in Curiosity – Paddle Raise
    • Keynote by chef and author J. Kenji Lopez-Alt
  • 1 p.m.: Optional tours of PacSci

Tickets

The Ignite Luncheon is free to attend, but registration is required. As PacSci’s biggest fundraising event of the year, we rely on the generosity of attendees to help us meet our fundraising goals and encourage guests to make a donation during the event. Donors contributing $500 or more will be recognized as members of PacSci’s Igniter Donor Society and receive a complimentary membership.

Can’t make it to the luncheon? You can still help!

Please consider making a donation in lieu of attendance. Your gift will be counted in our Challenge Pool of matching gifts and help inspire others to extend their support.

Give a gift

Keynote Speaker

J. Kenji López-Alt

Celebrated chef and food writer J. Kenji López-Alt is a New York Times columnist and the author of the New York Times best-selling and James Beard Award–winning cookbooks, The Food Lab and The Wok. Known for his approachable, science-driven style, Kenji has helped millions of home cooks understand how great food really works—and how to make it at home.

On YouTube, more than 1.5 million subscribers tune in to Kenji’s Cooking Show for his unedited, deeply nerdy kitchen experiments and practical cooking tips. He’s also the author of the best-selling children’s book, Every Night Is Pizza Night, a story about curiosity, community, and the joy of food.

Kenji lives in Seattle with his two children, where he spends his time exploring the city’s vibrant food scene and sharing his favorite local bites and hidden gems.

Contact

Thank you to our generous Sponsors:

Additional support provided by Pine Street Group and Region 6 Systems.

Sponsorship Opportunities

To learn more about sponsorship opportunities, please contact Shannon Lindgren. Align your brand to Seattle’s hub of curiosity and critical thinking while unlocking special benefits for your company and employees. Sponsorship opportunities start at $2,500.

excerpt.rendered: Join us to raise funds that will provide our critical thinkers of tomorrow with hands-on science experiences today.

content.rendered:
Join us for the third annual BrainFest, a day of brainy fun for all ages at PacSci. Explore hands-on activities, meet Allen Institute scientists and collaborators, learn about cutting-edge neuroscience research, and even touch a real brain!

Whether you’re a budding young scientist, a lifelong learner, or simply fascinated by how the mind works, BrainFest 2026 promises a full day of discovery, inspiration, and wonder.

Tickets

BrainFest is presented in partnership with the Allen Institute. A limited quantity of free General Admission tickets, courtesy of the Allen Institute, are available in a walk-up capacity on a first come, first served basis. Guests may also purchase a General Admission ticket online in advance.

In addition to admittance to PacSci’s exhibits, a General Admission ticket during BrainFest includes special programming that requires timed entry, such as scheduled planetarium shows, laser shows, and lectures in the PACCAR IMAX® Theater. Please visit the Main Entry and speak to a PacSci team member to reserve your timed entry for BrainFest programming. If you have purchased your ticket online, you may reserve your timed entry seating in advance.

Schedule

11:15–11:45 a.m.

Willard Smith Planetarium

The Universe Inside Your Head: a Journey through the Brain

What happens in your brain when you see a star? Learn how your eyes and brain interpret visual information while enjoying stunning imagery of real neurons and their constellations of connections.

11:30 a.m.–12:30 p.m.

PACCAR IMAX Theater

A Guided Tour of the Brain: Human Brain Dissection

Join local neuroscientists to explore the structures of the brain, featuring a real human brain donated to the University of Washington for educational use. Recommended for ages 10+.

1–1:30 p.m.

Laser Dome

Laser K-Pop Demon Hunters: Featuring Pre-show Talk on Lasers in Neuroscience

Before your laser show, enjoy a short talk by a neuroscientist from the Allen Institute exploring how we use LASER technology to better understand the brain.

1:30–1:50 p.m.

Live Science Stage

Brain Trivia Challenge

Learn fascinating facts about the most incredible organ in your body with this interactive trivia game for all ages!

2:30–3:30 p.m.

PACCAR IMAX Theater

A Guided Tour of the Brain: Human Brain Dissection

Join local neuroscientists to explore the structures of the brain, featuring a real human brain donated to the University of Washington for educational use. Recommended for ages 10+.

3:15–3:45 p.m.

Willard Smith Planetarium

The Universe Inside Your Head: A Journey Through the Brain

What happens in your brain when you see a star? Learn how your eyes and brain interpret visual information while enjoying stunning imagery of real neurons and their constellations of connections.

3:30–3:50 p.m.

Live Science Stage

Future Brain Tech: The Great Debate

How could futuristic brain technologies change our society, and which ones would you invite into your life? Join UW students in a thought-provoking bracket tournament to explore the societal impacts of future and emerging brain technologies.

4–4:30 p.m.

Laser Dome

Laser Show: Featuring Pre-show Talk on Lasers in Neuroscience

Before your laser show, enjoy a short talk by a neuroscientist from the Allen Institute exploring how we use LASER technology to better understand the brain.

This event is a partnership of the Allen Institute and Pacific Science Center.

content.rendered:
Celebrate the start of National Engineers Week with Engineering Day at PacSci! Join us on for an all-ages event highlighting the innovative engineering happening in the region. We’re hosting experts from across Washington at stations throughout the exhibit floor so you can meet an engineer and learn more about professions in STEM.

Explore how creative problem-solving and collective ingenuity shape the world around us. Dive into the technical details and discover how engineering disciplines work together to build a more sustainable and connected future. From aviation to robotics, learn how local engineers tackle complex challenges, ask your own questions, and engage in hands-on activities that show their work in action.

Special Thanks

This year’s Engineering Day is possible thanks to a special collaboration with Puget Sound Engineering Council (PSEC).

PSEC unites local chapters of various engineering societies to promote the profession and support STEM education through community outreach and volunteerism across the region.

excerpt.rendered: Visit PacSci to engage with local STEM professionals and participate in pop-up experiences that highlight the various facets of engineering.

content.rendered:
Sensory-Friendly Hours at Pacific Science Center are designed for learners of all ages with sensory sensitivities who benefit from a calmer and more accessible environment.

Formerly known as Exploration for All, these special events feature adjusted lighting and sound to ensure a welcoming and engaging experience for all attendees.

What to Expect

  • Softened lighting and reduced noise levels throughout the space.
  • Adjusted hands-on activities and exhibits tailored for a sensory-friendly experience.
  • Access to the Sensory Lounge, a quiet retreat available during all visits to PacSci.
  • A free social narrative is available online year-round to help guests plan their visit.

Contact us with any question or need more information. Learn more about Accessibility at PacSci.

Generous Support Provided By:

Additional support comes from more than 2,500 individuals, companies, and foundations that donate to the Science Center each year. Learn more about ways you can support the Access to Science Pipeline and Pacific Science Center.

excerpt.rendered: Formerly known as Exploration for All, Sensory-Friendly Hours provide a calmer environment for learners with sensory sensitivities.

content.rendered:
Once a month, homeschool families are invited to enjoy a day of discovery at Pacific Science Center with special discounted pricing. Experience hands-on learning, explore fascinating exhibits, and enjoy laser and planetarium shows.

Special programming

Gravitrax Marble Run in the Maker & Innovation Lab
Make a marble maze using Gravitrax marble run pieces. Test out how long, far, or fast can you go! Children under 8 must be accompanied by an adult.

Pricing

  • General Admission: $15 per person  
  • IMAX® Add-On: +$5 per person 

*Daytime laser and planetarium shows require a free timed-entry ticket on a first-come basis.

New Admissions Process

No reservations are needed! Enter through our Main Entry and inform our staff know you’re part of a homeschool group for your tickets.

Please Note:
Homeschool Days do not close Pacific Science Center’s campus to the general public. There may be other guests and school field trips on-site throughout the day.

excerpt.rendered: Once a month, homeschool families are invited to enjoy a day of discovery at Pacific Science Center with special discounted pricing.
